page.title: 14The Newsagent
page.content: A newsagent has to get up early in the morning,usually at about five o'clock to go to the station to collect the newspapers which come by train from London where thet are printed. Boys and girls are employed to deliver the papers to peoples homes in the village. Six boys and girls do paper-rounds in Hawkinge.They are all school children aged 13 and over. They deliver the papers before going to school each morning. The newsagents shop opens to sell papers,magazines,tobacco,cigarettes, sweets,chocolate,toys,books, staionery,drinks,crisps,ice-lollies and other things from 6.30 in the morning until six o'clock in the evening.The newsagent's name is Mr. Lawrence.
